relation: IQUI BBBB IDCCCC MSCats\sare\horrible DI1 TL-1
A QUI that is sent from the hub indicating that the client BBBB has disconnected.

A QUI that is sent from the hub indicating that the client BBBB has disconnected. The originator of the action is the client with the SID CCCC. The message "Cats are horrible" is included. All clients should terminate their connections with the client BBBB (DI1). The client should never attempt to reconnect (TL-1).
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {1396=Many ideas for the protocol come from Jan Vidar Krey’s DCTNG draft. Major contributors include Dustin Brody, Walter Doekes, Timmo Stange, Fredrik Ullner, Fredrik Stenberg and others. Jon Hess contributed the original Direct Connect idea through the Neo-Modus Direct Connect client / hub.}
textBeforeTable: 6.3.1. STA 6.3. Commands <data> CSND … CGET … CINF IDxxx CINF IDxxx TO<token> CSUP ADBASE ADTIGR … CSUP ADBASE ADTIGR … Server Client 6.2. Client – Client connection … … BINF <Client-SID> BINF <all clients> HPAS … IGPA … BINF <my-sid> ID… PD… IINF CT32 … ISID <client-sid> ISUP ADBASE ADTIGR … HSUP ADBASE ADTIGR
textAfterTable: 6.3.2. SUP Example Description ISUP ADBASE ADTIGR ADBLOM A SUP sent from a hub indicating that the hub has added the features BASE, TIGR and BLOM. HSUP RMBLOM ADZLIF A SUP sent from a client to the hub indicating that the client has added the fature ZLIF and removed the feature BLOM. 6.3.3. SID Example Description ISID BBBB An SID is sent from the hub indicating that the client’s SID from then on shall be BBBB. 6.3.4. INF Example Description IINF CT32 NIexample_hub DEThe\s\simple\shub An INF is sent from the hub containing its own information: the name is "example_hub" and description "The simple hub".
